body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir.

We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell County Ky. have long known Thomas. B. Wadlington & he has ever been considered a good & true hearted citizen, Known & noted for his industry & his peaceable & orderely conduct -- The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A. Cartwright did not appear, to us, to be of his own seeking, nor are we saitsfied, ^or do believe^ that the case was fairly fairly presented to the Jury, as it occured. We hope your Excellency will review the case, and give the poor man the benefit of every doubt. & we desire that his case may be judged in mercey & regarded with favor, and that your Excellency will take into consideration, every circumstance that ought to operate in his behalf, And we desire that your Excellency may be persuaded that it is consistent with your duty to extend to him Executive Clemency, and that his life may be spared, either by a full pardon, or by a commutation of his punishment --

Jany 22 1861
Yours respectfully
F H Baker
S. D. Scott
E F Hill
F D Wyatt
A. G. farley
G H Bugg
R C Greene
W B Bush
A, G, Wilson
J, H, Maxwell
J M Moore
Wm S. Johnson
